comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: I could not find any film made in 1960 Dublin, but here is a good film of "C I E in the 1960's" just to pass the time. www.youtube.com/watch?v=6X-smrTKK54

comment.author: 66151649@N02
66151649@N02
comment._content:
Anybody see Robert Mitchum in the crowd? lol

They filmed "Michael Collins" and "Angela's Ashes" here, but those are much later than the 60's.

comment.author: 77848526@N06
comment._content: It might be a TV ad, although obviously not for RTE. Or it could be a newsreel...

comment.author: 54968992@N03
comment._content: I use  to know once the train hit Westland row from Bray we were at the end of the line for getting off in Tara Street :(

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] "A Terrible Beauty" Release Date: 17 June 1960 (West Germany), before this photo. www.imdb.com/title/tt0054120/ [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77848526@N06] TV ad and newsreels usually had smaller cine cameras at this time.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
Movies made in Ardmore studios in 1960


A Terrible Beauty1960Tay Garnett
The Night Fighters1960Tay Garnett   
The Siege of Sidney Street1960Robert S. Baker
Monty Berman
The Sword of Sherwood Forest1960Terence Fisher

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: "The Night Fighters" is an alternative title for "A Terrible Beauty". Monty Berman was a producer on "The Siege of Sidney Street".

comment.author: 31536722@N00
comment._content: Hasn't changed much over the years. They're renovating the whole place at the moment but the roof looks filthy today compared to what it was here. Wonder if they used to clean it back then?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Great way to pass the time, Old Pete! Loved that video - bet there are fleeting glimpses of some C.I.É fellas from our O'Dea photos on there...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 60812213@N04
comment._content:
The CIE staff in this shot are very clean and tidy [sorry lads], so I assume the platform is full of extras [background people] for the film. Also, some are carrying a4 sheets, script papers.
Even the tracks and sleepers have been cleaned.

comment.author: 38401430@N06
comment._content: I am intrigued to how the story of "The Sword of Sherwood Forest" could possibly be linked to a railway station in Ireland?

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38401430@N06] One of many films and TV made at Ardmore Studios, Bray, County Wicklow. www.ardmore.ie/ True, there was not much call for a railway station from Robin Hood.
